meanings.definition: The quality or state of being strong and healthy.
meanings.sent1: The robustnesses of the old tree impressed the hikers.
meanings.sent2: The doctor was pleased with the patient's robustnesses after the surgery.
meanings.sent3: The robustnesses of the superhero's powers made the villains envious.
meanings.sent4: Her robustnesses were like a suit of armor, protecting her from harm.
meanings.sent5: The robustnesses of the castle walls withstood the test of time.

meanings.definition: The ability to withstand or overcome difficult conditions.
meanings.sent1: The robustnesses of the mountain goats allowed them to climb steep cliffs.
meanings.sent2: The robustnesses of the team were tested during the challenging project.
meanings.sent3: The robustnesses of the umbrella in the wind made it fly away like Mary Poppins.
meanings.sent4: His mental robustnesses were like a shield against stress and anxiety.
meanings.sent5: The robustnesses of the ship helped it navigate through the stormy seas.

meanings.definition: The extent to which something is able to perform effectively under a variety of conditions.
meanings.sent1: The robustnesses of the car's engine ensured a smooth ride in all terrains.
meanings.sent2: The software developer focused on improving the robustnesses of the program.
meanings.sent3: The robustnesses of the chef's cooking skills were put to the test in the cooking competition.
meanings.sent4: Her emotional robustnesses allowed her to handle any situation with grace.
meanings.sent5: The robustnesses of the bridge design prevented it from collapsing under heavy traffic.
